CITY COUNCIL DISTRICT 2

![](https://ci.lubbock.tx.us/storage/images/FV9kwKW3UjI7gDPKdVnww45Uj4MbdwH7ms4sSLs5.jpg)

Gordon Harris, District 2
-------------------------

Gordon Harris was elected to the Lubbock City Council in District 2 on June 15, 2024.

A lifelong Lubbock resident, Gordon is dedicated to making positive changes in his community. Gordon started his journey at Estacado High School and later worked as the Assistant Administrator for the Lubbock Independent School Districtâ€™s alternative education program. He was a UIL Basketball Referee and a member of the Texas High School Basketball Officials Association for 37 years. His work in education has given him valuable insights into community needs and challenges.

Known for his strong ties to District 2, Harris is committed to being a true representative for his neighbors. His approach to leadership emphasizes community engagement, transparency, and commitment to his district. He works hard to ensure that District 2 and the City of Lubbock gets the attention and improvements it deserves, aiming to highlight its potential and enhance its vibrancy.

As a Council member, Harris focuses on being a true voice for his community. He is committed to bringing about real change and addressing the issues that matter most to his constituents. Harris aims to support growth and economic development in all of Lubbock.
